channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Film takes Best Picture, Director
item.description: "Birdman" and "Grand Budapest" tie for the most Oscars at the 87th Academy Awards as a performance by John Legend and Common reduces many to tears.

item.title: ISIS parades Peshmerga in cages
item.description: ISIS has released a new propaganda video showing what appear to be Kurdish Peshmerga fighters being paraded down Iraqi streets in cages.

item.title: Al Jazeera journalists fight charges in Egypt
item.description: Two journalists freed on bail from an Egyptian prison savor freedom after more than 400 days behind bars, but say the fight's not over yet.

item.title: Suspects accused of Paris Metro abuse
item.description: British police identify three men who were allegedly involved in the abuse of a black man who was stopped from boarding a train by chanting football fans.

item.title: France battles ISIS online
item.description: As ominous music plays, the ISIS flag flutters, child fighters wield weapons and graphic images of beheadings flash across the screen.

item.title: 5 terror groups in headlines
item.description: The terror groups are getting more ruthless, their attacks more brazen.

item.title: Dozens die in ferry sinking
item.description: Officials are still trying to determine how many people were on board the ferry when it collided with a boat and capsized on the Padma River in Bangladesh.

item.title: Yellow dust blankets Seoul
item.description: South Korean officials issue health warnings as hazardous levels of yellow dust blanket parts of the country. CNN's Paula Hancocks reports

item.title: Pyongyang bans foreign runners
item.description: Distance runners looking for an unconventional challenge will have to look beyond the Korean peninsula for now -- North Korea has barred foreign participants from April's Mangyongdae Prize Marathon, held in the capital, Pyongyang.

item.title: Al-Shabaab calls for mall attacks
item.description: Terror group Al-Shabaab releases a video calling for attacks on shopping malls in Canada, the UK and the United States.

item.title: Come home, pleads UK girl's family
item.description: The family of a girl whom UK police say may be headed to Syria with two friends are pleading for her to return home.

item.title: Liberia lifts Ebola curfew
item.description: Liberia is reopening its land border crossings shut down during the Ebola outbreak, a positive sign in a nation that was the epicenter of the deadly virus.

item.title: Egypt backs 'unified Arab force'
item.description: As threats in the Middle East grow, there's a pressing need in the region, Egypt's President said Sunday.

item.title: Blast rocks Ukraine peace protest
item.description: Police officers are among the two dead and 15 wounded after an explosion during a peaceful protest in the eastern city of Kharkiv, Ukraine's Interior Ministry said Sunday.

item.title: Australia to appoint security czar
item.description: Australia will toughen its citizenship laws as part of the government's new counter-terrorism strategy, Prime Minister Tony Abbott announced in a national security address Monday.

item.title: Mass rally after Yemeni president flees
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of supporters of Yemeni President Abdu Rabu Mansour Hadi filled the streets of seven Yemeni provinces on Sunday, one day after Hadi escaped house arrest in the capital, Sanaa.

item.title: Men in skirts support women's rights
item.description: It's not unusual for men to join the fight for women's rights. But it is if they choose to wear miniskirts while they do it.

item.title: Turkish forces empty Syria tomb
item.description: Turkish soldiers guarding the Tomb of Suleyman Shah, who was grandfather of the founder of the Ottoman Empire, have evacuated along with the remains from the Syrian tomb.

item.title: Stolen iPhone traced to China
item.description: CNN's John Vause talks with Matt Stopera who found his stolen iPhone in China, when photos of a man dubbed "Brother Orange" started showing up on his feed.

item.title: -40 wind chill in parts of U.S.
item.description: For much of the U.S., stepping into a walk-in freezer will be a lot more comfortable than going outside.

item.title: 89 children abducted in school raid
item.description: Armed groups raided a South Sudanese school and seized 89 children who were taking their exams, the United Nations said Saturday. It pointed out that boys were among those taken.

item.title: Bobbi Kristina's boyfriend, dad feud
item.description: As Bobbi Kristina Brown fights for her life at an Atlanta hospital, the public spat between her boyfriend and her family goes on.

item.title: Watson addresses Prince Harry rumors
item.description: Emma Watson took to Twitter on Sunday to quell rumors that she and Prince Harry are dating, reminding the world that marrying a prince is "not a prerequisite for being a Princess."

item.title: Michael Phelps: 'She said yes'
item.description: Is Olympic gold medalist swimmer Michael Phelps engaged?

item.title: Best of the Oscars red carpet
Oscars 2015: The winners list
item.description: Here's the list of nominees for the 87th Academy Awards. Winners are noted with an asterisk.

item.title: Best images from Oscar night
item.description: Memorable moments from the 87th Academy Awards on Sunday, February 22

item.title: The Oscars take on inequality
item.description: The talented, charismatic and handsome Neil Patrick Harris brilliantly ushered this year's Oscars through the potential landmines of political commentary and irreverent humor. Indeed, from hosting many of the entertainment world's most prestigious award shows, to posing on the recent cover of Architectural Digest with his husband David Burtka, it's nearly impossible not to see Harris front and center somewhere.

item.title: And the Razzie goes to...
item.description: Kirk Cameron swept the 2015 Razzie Awards on Saturday, picking up the dubious honors of worst picture and actor for "Kirk Cameron's Saving Christmas."

item.title: How big a threat is al Shabaab to Western malls?
Photos capture China's annual travel crush
Rafael Nadal exits on Rio clay
Is this the Formula One star of the future?
And the world's best beach is ...
Beauty's many faces around the globe
Impossible Photoshop images that will beguile your brain
Photos of Pluto moons open new door
CNN's Tech Awards: Top honors
item.description: CNN's Samuel Burke picks his own winners for his second annual Tech Awards.

item.title: New Year party
item.description: Each day, CNN brings you an image capturing a sublime moment, defining the present in our changing world.

item.title: Fall of Debaltseve sends shockwaves through region
item.description: The separatists' takeover of Debaltseve is making waves throughout the region and inside the troubled town. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh.

item.title: The key battlegrounds in the fight against ISIS
item.description: CNN's Tim Lister looks at where the battle for ISIS is raging and why those regions are strategically important.

item.title: Who is on al Qaeda's 'wanted' list?
item.description: CNN's Nic Robertson reports on the 11 people who are included on a "wanted" list published by al Qaeda in the spring of 2013.

item.title: Beyonc√©'s leaked photos: What's the big deal?
item.description: CNN's Nima Elbagir explores the controversy surrounding unretouched photos of the famous pop singer.

item.title: Is this toothy material nature's strongest?
item.description: Researchers from the University of Portsmouth say they believe the teeth from a limpet are the strongest material in nature. CNN's Max Foster reports.

item.title: The weird way Oscar votes are counted
item.description: Every year the debates rage on: Why did that movie or actor win an Oscar? But there is a method to the awards show madness.

item.title: Shocking video captures racist football fans abuse
Oscar newcomers react to nominations
item.description: CNN's Neil Curry takes a look at some of the first-time Academy Award nominees for 2015.

item.title: Stunt plane mid-air collision caught on tape in India
item.description: Two stunt aircraft collided in mid-air while performing at the Aero India defense expo. The pilots managed to land safely, eyewitnesses said.
